AOP entity (KE/KER): MIE: Oxidative Stress (Event 1); initiating event in AOP network leading to airway dysfunction
Input (manipulation / sample): Human airway epithelial cells; exposure to oxidants (H₂O₂, cigarette smoke extract, PM2.5, acrolein, ozone); in vivo animal models with environmental exposures
Method / Assay (SOP notes): Reactive oxygen species (ROS) measurement using fluorescent probes (DCFDA, DHE, MitoSOX for mitochondrial ROS). Flow cytometry or fluorescence microscopy for quantification. Lipid peroxidation assays (malondialdehyde, 4-HNE, 8-isoprostane by ELISA or LC-MS). Protein oxidation (protein carbonyls, nitrotyrosine). DNA oxidation (8-OHdG). Antioxidant enzyme activity (SOD, catalase, GPx). GSH/GSSG ratio.
Output / Measurement: ROS levels (fluorescence intensity, fold change); Lipid peroxidation products (MDA, 4-HNE, 8-isoprostane); Protein oxidation markers; DNA damage (8-OHdG); Antioxidant capacity (GSH/GSSG, enzyme activities); Dose-response and time-course
Interpretation / Context fields to captu: Cell type; oxidant type and concentration; exposure duration; ROS probe specifics and loading conditions; detection method (flow cytometry, microscopy, plate reader); antioxidant treatments; normalization approach; positive/negative controls; replicate number
Exemplar peer-reviewed manuscripts: Riva et al. (2011). [Oxidative stress measurement in inhalation toxicology]. Inhalation Toxicology.
Protocol / SOP notes (attach): Include oxidant exposure protocol, ROS probe selection and validation, fluorescence detection parameters, lipid peroxidation assay procedures, antioxidant enzyme assays, quality control for probe specificity, time-course optimization
S&T considerations (ontology / mapping): Biolink: MeasurementProcess; OBI: fluorescence assay, ELISA, enzyme activity assay; Mapping: MIE oxidative stress (Event 1); CHEBI: ROS, oxidants, antioxidants; Initiating molecular event; Dose-response for AOP threshold

AOP entity (KE/KER): MIE: Oxidative Stress (Event 1); KER: Oxidative stress → EGFR activation → inflammatory response
Input (manipulation / sample): Human bronchial epithelial cells; PM2.5 exposure; assessment of oxidative stress and inflammatory pathways
Method / Assay (SOP notes): PM2.5 exposure system for in vitro cultures. ROS measurement (DCFDA). Mitochondrial function assessment (mitophagy markers LC3, PINK1, Parkin by Western blot and immunofluorescence). Inflammatory cytokine secretion (IL-6, IL-8 by ELISA). EGFR and MAPK pathway activation (Western blot for pEGFR, pERK). Antioxidant interventions to validate oxidative mechanism.
Output / Measurement: ROS levels; Mitophagy marker expression; Inflammatory cytokine secretion (IL-6, IL-8); EGFR and MAPK activation; Antioxidant rescue effects; Dose-response to PM2.5
Interpretation / Context fields to captu: PM2.5 source and characterization; exposure concentration and duration; ROS detection method; Western blot antibodies; ELISA platforms; antioxidant type and concentration; cell viability; normalization method; replicate number
Exemplar peer-reviewed manuscripts: Zhai et al. (2022). PM2.5 induces inflammatory responses via oxidative stress-mediated mitophagy in human bronchial epithelial cells.
Protocol / SOP notes (attach): Document PM2.5 preparation and exposure, ROS measurement protocol, mitophagy assessment (Western blot, immunofluorescence), inflammatory mediator quantification, pathway analysis, antioxidant intervention studies
S&T considerations (ontology / mapping): Biolink: MeasurementProcess; OBI: multiple assay types; Mapping: MIE oxidative stress, KER oxidative stress → EGFR → inflammation; ENVO: PM2.5 exposure; Environmental health; Mechanistic pathway linkage

AOP entity (KE/KER): MIE: Oxidative Stress (Event 1); mode of action assessment for aldehyde toxicant
Input (manipulation / sample): 3D human airway tissue model (e.g., MucilAir, EpiAirway); acrolein exposure at air-liquid interface
Method / Assay (SOP notes): Dose-response assessment of acrolein toxicity. Oxidative stress measurement (ROS, GSH depletion). Cytotoxicity (LDH, MTT, membrane integrity). Inflammatory markers (IL-6, IL-8). Histopathology. Gene expression profiling for oxidative stress response genes (NRF2 pathway, antioxidant enzymes). Mode of action analysis linking oxidative stress to downstream effects.
Output / Measurement: ROS levels; GSH/GSSG ratio; Cytotoxicity metrics (LDH, viability); Inflammatory cytokine levels; Histological changes; NRF2 pathway activation; Oxidative stress gene expression; Dose-response curves
Interpretation / Context fields to captu: 3D tissue model type; days at differentiation; acrolein concentration range; exposure duration; ROS/GSH assays; cytotoxicity assays; ELISA for cytokines; gene expression methods; histology protocols; replicate tissues; benchmark comparisons
Exemplar peer-reviewed manuscripts: Xiong et al. [Evaluating Mode of Action of Acrolein Toxicity in an In Vitro Human Airway Tissue Model].
Protocol / SOP notes (attach): Include acrolein exposure protocol for ALI, oxidative stress assays (ROS, GSH), cytotoxicity endpoints, inflammatory mediator measurement, gene expression analysis, histology, mode of action framework linking oxidative stress to apical outcomes
S&T considerations (ontology / mapping): Biolink: MeasurementProcess; OBI: 3D tissue model assay; Mapping: MIE oxidative stress, mode of action pathway; CHEBI: acrolein; Toxicology; Adverse outcome pathway; Mechanistic toxicology

KE / Domain: Oxidative stress biomarkers in respiratory disease
AOP entity (KE/KER): MIE: Oxidative Stress (Event 1); clinical biomarkers and relationship to lung function
Input (manipulation / sample): Clinical samples from patients (exhaled breath condensate, serum, BALF); correlation with lung function
Method / Assay (SOP notes): Clinical oxidative stress biomarker assessment. Exhaled breath condensate (EBC) collection and analysis for 8-isoprostane, MDA, H₂O₂. Serum oxidative markers. BALF analysis. Correlation with spirometry (FEV1, FVC). Longitudinal monitoring. Comparison across disease states (asthma, COPD, healthy controls).
Output / Measurement: EBC biomarker levels (8-isoprostane, MDA, H₂O₂); Serum oxidative markers; BALF markers; Correlation with lung function parameters; Differences across disease phenotypes; Longitudinal changes
Interpretation / Context fields to captu: Patient characteristics; disease diagnosis and severity; medication use; EBC collection protocol; sample processing and storage; assay platforms; lung function testing; statistical analysis for biomarker-function correlations; confounding factors
Exemplar peer-reviewed manuscripts: Havet et al. (2018). [Oxidative stress biomarkers in respiratory disease]. Eur Respir J.
Protocol / SOP notes (attach): Include EBC collection SOP, sample handling, biomarker assay protocols (ELISA, LC-MS), spirometry procedures, statistical methods for correlation analysis, quality control for EBC and assays
S&T considerations (ontology / mapping): Biolink: ClinicalMeasurement; OBI: biomarker assay; Mapping: MIE oxidative stress in clinical context; Clinical translation; Non-invasive biomarker; Correlation with AO (lung function)

AOP entity (KE/KER): MIE: Oxidative Stress (Event 1); downstream signaling cascades (NRF2, NF-κB, MAPK)
Input (manipulation / sample): Human airway epithelial cells; oxidant exposures; pathway-specific inhibitors and activators
Method / Assay (SOP notes): Oxidative stress-induced signaling pathway analysis. NRF2 activation (nuclear translocation, target gene expression). NF-κB activation (IκB degradation, p65 nuclear translocation, reporter assays). MAPK activation (Western blot for pERK, pJNK, pp38). Antioxidant response element (ARE) reporter assays. ChIP for NRF2 binding. Gene expression profiling of pathway targets.
Output / Measurement: NRF2 activation (nuclear localization, ARE activity, target gene expression); NF-κB activation; MAPK phosphorylation; Pathway-specific gene expression; Dose-response and kinetics; Inhibitor validation
Interpretation / Context fields to captu: Cell type; oxidant stimulus; pathway inhibitors/activators; Western blot antibodies; immunofluorescence for nuclear translocation; reporter constructs; ChIP antibodies and primers; qRT-PCR for target genes; time-course; replicate number
Exemplar peer-reviewed manuscripts: Piao et al. (2021). [Oxidative stress signaling in airways]. Int J Mol Sci.
Protocol / SOP notes (attach): Document oxidant exposure, pathway analysis methods (Western blot, immunofluorescence, reporter assays, ChIP), gene expression profiling, inhibitor studies, time-course design, pathway crosstalk analysis
S&T considerations (ontology / mapping): Biolink: MeasurementProcess; OBI: Western blot, reporter assay, ChIP-qPCR; Mapping: MIE oxidative stress, downstream signaling pathways (NRF2, NF-κB, MAPK); Mechanistic understanding; Pathway integration

AOP entity (KE/KER): MIE: Oxidative Stress (Event 1); assessment in physiologically relevant airway tissue models
Input (manipulation / sample): 3D organotypic airway cultures (ALI); environmental or chemical oxidant exposures; comparison to 2D cultures
Method / Assay (SOP notes): Oxidative stress measurement in 3D tissue models. ROS detection in differentiated airway epithelium. Antioxidant capacity assessment. Tissue viability and function during oxidant challenge. Comparison of oxidative stress sensitivity in 2D vs 3D. Multi-endpoint assessment (oxidative stress, inflammation, barrier function, ciliary function).
Output / Measurement: ROS levels in 3D tissues; GSH/GSSG; Tissue viability; Inflammatory responses; Barrier integrity (TEER); Ciliary function; Comparison of 2D vs 3D oxidative stress responses
Interpretation / Context fields to captu: 3D culture model type; differentiation status; oxidant exposure protocol; ROS detection in 3D (confocal imaging, tissue extraction); antioxidant measurements; multi-endpoint integration; model validation; replicate tissues
Exemplar peer-reviewed manuscripts: Faber et al. (2020). [Oxidative stress in 3D airway tissue models].
Protocol / SOP notes (attach): Include 3D culture protocol, oxidant exposure for ALI, ROS measurement in 3D context, tissue-level antioxidant assays, multi-endpoint assessment, 2D-3D comparison, model validation
S&T considerations (ontology / mapping): Biolink: MeasurementProcess; OBI: 3D tissue model assay; Mapping: MIE oxidative stress; In vitro model; Physiological relevance; Multi-endpoint integration; Model comparison

AOP entity (KE/KER): MIE: Oxidative Stress (Event 1); multi-omics and systems biology approaches
Input (manipulation / sample): Airway epithelial cells or tissues; oxidant exposures; integrated multi-omics analysis
Method / Assay (SOP notes): Comprehensive oxidative stress characterization. Transcriptomics (RNA-seq for oxidative stress gene networks). Proteomics (mass spectrometry for oxidized proteins, redox proteomics). Metabolomics (redox metabolites, TCA cycle, amino acid oxidation). Lipidomics (oxidized lipids). Integration of multi-omics data. Pathway and network analysis. Predictive modeling.
Output / Measurement: Transcriptomic signatures of oxidative stress; Proteomic changes (total and oxidized proteins); Metabolomic profiles (GSH metabolism, energy metabolism); Lipid peroxidation products; Integrated pathway analysis; Predictive biomarker signatures
Interpretation / Context fields to captu: Sample type; oxidant exposure; omics platforms (RNA-seq, MS proteomics, MS metabolomics/lipidomics); bioinformatics pipelines; data integration methods; pathway databases; normalization and batch correction; validation cohorts or experiments; statistical modeling
Exemplar peer-reviewed manuscripts: Vitucci et al. (2024). [Multi-omics profiling of oxidative stress in airways].
Protocol / SOP notes (attach): Document sample preparation for each omics platform, data generation protocols, bioinformatics workflows, quality control, data integration strategy, pathway analysis methods, validation approaches, systems biology modeling
S&T considerations (ontology / mapping): Biolink: IntegratedDataset; OBI: multi-omics assays; Mapping: MIE oxidative stress, systems-level response; Transcriptomics, proteomics, metabolomics, lipidomics; Network biology; Predictive modeling; Precision medicine

KE / Domain: Oxidative stress in chronic airway disease
AOP entity (KE/KER): MIE: Oxidative Stress (Event 1); role in disease progression and exacerbations
Input (manipulation / sample): Patient cohorts (asthma, COPD); longitudinal studies; oxidative stress biomarkers and clinical outcomes
Method / Assay (SOP notes): Clinical assessment of oxidative stress in chronic airway disease. Biomarker measurement in multiple matrices (EBC, blood, sputum, urine). Correlation with disease severity, exacerbation frequency, lung function decline. Environmental exposure assessment (air pollution, smoking). Longitudinal monitoring. Interventions (antioxidant therapy) and biomarker responses.
Output / Measurement: Oxidative stress biomarker levels across disease states; Correlation with FEV1 and disease severity; Association with exacerbation risk; Environmental exposure-biomarker relationships; Antioxidant intervention effects; Longitudinal trajectories
Interpretation / Context fields to captu: Study population; disease definitions; exacerbation criteria; biomarker collection protocols; exposure assessment methods; lung function testing; longitudinal follow-up; intervention details; statistical models; confounding adjustment
Exemplar peer-reviewed manuscripts: Mann et al. [Oxidative stress in CHAPS study - chronic airway disease].
Protocol / SOP notes (attach): Document study design, participant characterization, biomarker collection and assays, exposure assessment, clinical endpoint definitions, statistical analysis plan, quality assurance
S&T considerations (ontology / mapping): Biolink: ClinicalStudy; OBI: longitudinal cohort study; Mapping: MIE oxidative stress, AO lung function and exacerbations; Clinical translation; Prognostic biomarker; Therapeutic target; Environmental health

AOP entity (KE/KER): MIE: Oxidative Stress (Event 1); relationship to airway inflammatory endotypes
Input (manipulation / sample): CHAPS cohort; oxidative stress and inflammation profiling; phenotype/endotype classification
Method / Assay (SOP notes): Integrated oxidative stress and inflammatory profiling. Oxidative biomarkers (EBC, serum). Inflammatory markers (blood and airway). Multivariate analysis to identify phenotypes/endotypes. Cluster analysis. Association with clinical features and outcomes. Molecular signatures of oxidative-inflammatory phenotypes.
Output / Measurement: Oxidative stress biomarker profiles; Inflammatory marker profiles; Phenotype/endotype classifications; Cluster characteristics; Molecular signatures; Clinical correlates of oxidative-inflammatory phenotypes
Interpretation / Context fields to captu: Cohort description; biomarker panels; clustering algorithms; validation cohorts; clinical phenotyping criteria; omics integration; statistical methods; biomarker-phenotype associations
Exemplar peer-reviewed manuscripts: Zhang et al. [CHAPS - oxidative stress and inflammatory phenotypes in airways].
Protocol / SOP notes (attach): Include biomarker measurement protocols, clustering and classification methods, phenotype validation, clinical correlation analysis, molecular profiling, statistical approaches for phenotype discovery
S&T considerations (ontology / mapping): Biolink: ClinicalStudy; OBI: phenotyping study; Mapping: MIE oxidative stress, inflammatory response, disease heterogeneity; Precision medicine; Endotyping; Biomarker signatures; Therapeutic stratification

AOP entity (KE/KER): MIE: Oxidative Stress (Event 1); integration across molecular, cellular, tissue, and organism levels
Input (manipulation / sample): Multi-scale studies from in vitro to clinical; oxidative stress as integrating concept across AOP network
Method / Assay (SOP notes): Multi-scale oxidative stress assessment. In vitro ROS and antioxidant measurements. Cellular responses (signaling, inflammation, toxicity). Tissue-level effects (histology, function). Clinical biomarkers. In vitro-in vivo extrapolation. Computational modeling of oxidative stress propagation through AOP network. Integration with other molecular initiating events (EGFR activation).
Output / Measurement: Oxidative stress metrics at molecular, cellular, tissue, organism levels; In vitro-in vivo correlations; AOP network connectivity; Computational model predictions; Integrated risk assessment
Interpretation / Context fields to captu: Multi-scale experimental design; in vitro and clinical protocols; IVIVE methods; computational modeling approaches; network analysis; uncertainty quantification; validation datasets
Exemplar peer-reviewed manuscripts: Misiukiewicz-Stepien et al. (2025). [Multi-scale oxidative stress integration in airway AOP].
Protocol / SOP notes (attach): Document multi-scale study design, assay protocols at each level, IVIVE methodology, computational modeling framework, network integration, validation strategy
S&T considerations (ontology / mapping): Biolink: IntegratedSystem; OBI: multi-scale analysis; Mapping: MIE oxidative stress across all levels of AOP; Systems toxicology; IVIVE; Computational modeling; Quantitative AOP; Risk assessment
